Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding to defray travel related expenses of participants at the conference "Midwestern Workshop on Asymptotic Analysis" that will be held at Indiana University- Purdue University Indianapolis, October 6-8, 2017.

The conference focuses on recent developments in Analysis, especially in the fields of mathematical physics, approximation theory, and complex analysis. A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to attend and speak at this conference. This award gives early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, researchers not funded by NSF and the like an opportunity to attend and participate in this conference. The organizing committee will strive to make this funding opportunity known to target groups through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at:
http://mwaa.math.iupui.edu/

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goal of the Midwestern Workshop on Asymptotic Analysis (MWAA) is to facilitate interactions between mathematicians from the midwestern United States working in approximation theory, mathematical physics, potential theory, and complex analysis by bringing them together in an informal way for a two day workshop. The major objectives include exposing attending graduate students to different areas of analysis, finding early career mathematicians and giving them an opportunity to present their work, and strengthening the partnership and increasing the collaboration between analysts in the midwest.

This award was received to support MWAA held on Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) during October 6–8th, 2017. Among the speakers, there were 3 post-doctoral fellows and 2 junior faculty. Out of 11 speakers, 5 were women and 3 were senior mathematicians based overseas. There were 43 participants altogether, including 21 graduate students and 4 post-doctoral fellows, 9 of the participants were women. Abstracts and slides from the talks and posters from students are available through the Workshop web site, http://mwaa.math.iupui.edu/.

The leftover funds were used to cover the expenses of the PI and three IUPUI math graduate students for attending MWAA at Indiana University (IU), Bloomington, Indiana in 20018 and then to support three IUPUI and four IU graduate students that attended MWAA at Purdue University, Fort Wayne in 2019.
